In December 2024, Old Aptiv (as defined below), a public limited company formed under the laws of Jersey on May 19, 2011, completed its reorganization transaction . The previous publicly-listed Jersey parent company, which was an Irish tax resident, is referred to as “Old Aptv” throughout this Annual Report on Form 10-K .
 In connection with the Transaction, New Aptiv assumed the Long-Term Incentive Plans and its existing obligations in connection with awards granted thereunder . All debts, liabilities and duties of Old Aptv . became debts and liabilities of Apti Swiss Holdings, and all debts, . liabilities, and duties, of Old. tiv, became debts, liability and . duties of Aaptiv Swiss Holdings .
 Aptiv is a global technology company focused on making the world safer, greener and more connected . We deliver end-to-end mobility solutions, enabling our customers’ transition to a more electrified, software-defined future . We design and manufacture vehicle components and provide electrical, electronic and active safety technology to the global automotive and commercial vehicle markets .
 The company plans to complete the separation by March 31, 2026, subject to customary closing conditions . The separation is expected to be treated as a tax-free transaction to Aptiv’s shareholders . The company's website address is  www.aptiv.com . The website is available to download any of the company's 10-K, 10-Q or 8-Q filings .
 In 2024, 29% of our net sales came from the Asia Pacific region, which we have identified as a key market likely . Our business is diversified across end-markets, regions, customers, vehicle platforms and products . We provide critical technologies and services to enhance vehicle safety, security, comfort and convenience .
 In 2024, our products were found in 17 of the 20 top-selling vehicle models in the U.S. and Europe . We expect long-term growth of global vehicle sales and production in the OEM market . The automotive technology and components industry provides critical technologies, components, systems, subsystems and modules to the manufacture of new vehicles .
 Global automotive vehicle production decreased 1% (3% on an Aptiv weighted market basis, which represents global vehicle production weighted to the geographic regions in which the Company generates its revenue) from 2023 to 2024 . Vehicle production declines of 5% in Europe and 2% in North America, partially offset by increased production of 4% in China and 3% in South America .
 The first mega-trend, “Safe,” represents technologies aimed not just at protecting vehicle occupants when a crash occurs, but those that proactively reduce the risk of a crash occurring . The second, "Green," represents technologies designed to help reduce emissions, increase fuel economy and minimize the environmental impact of vehicles .
 EPA proposed new rules in 2023 that could require as much as 67% of all light-duty vehicles by model year 2032 to be all-electric . California Air Resources Board approved rules in 2022 that require that all new passenger cars and light trucks sold in California be electric vehicles or other zero-emission models by 2035 .
 The technology content of vehicles continues to increase as consumers demand greater safety, personalization, infotainment, productivity and convenience while driving . The third mega-trend, “Connected,” represents technologies designed to seamlessly integrate today’s highly complex vehicles into the electronic operating environment . We are also enabling the trend towards vehicle electrification with high voltage electrification solutions that reduce CO2 emissions and increase fuel economy .
 Electronics integration will allow OEMs to achieve substantial reductions in weight and mechanical complexity . Automation will allow for easier assembly, enhanced fuel economy, improved emissions control and better vehicle performance . The combination of advanced technologies being developed within these mega-trends is contributing to the digital transformation across mission-critical industries . The benefits of increased vehicle automation include enhanced safety (resulting from collision avoidance and improved vehicle control)
 As part of our strategy, we acquired Wind River Systems, Inc. (“Wind River”) Wind River is a global leader in delivering software for the intelligent edge for multiple industries, including automotive . We believe we are well-aligned with industry technology trends that will help to support sustainable future growth in this space .
 In May 2024, Aptiv agreed to reduce its stake in Motional from 50% to approximately 15% . The total gain recorded as a result of these transactions was approximately $641 million ($2.50 per share) in the year ended December 31, 2024, within net gain on equity method transactions in the consolidated statements of operations .
 Suppliers that can provide fully engineered solutions, systems and pre-assembled combinations of component parts are positioned to leverage the trend toward system sourcing . Manufacturers with strong technologies, robust global engineering and development capabilities will be best positioned to meet OEM demands for rapid innovation . The company's organizational structure and management reporting support the management of these core product lines: Advanced Safety and User Experience .
 Our products provide the signal distribution and computing power backbone that supports increased vehicle content and electrification, reduced emissions, higher fuel economy and off-vehicle connectivity . Electrical Centers provide centralized electrical power and signal distribution . Electrical Distribution Systems, including 48-volt hybrid and high voltage systems, are integrated into one optimized vehicle electrical system that can utilize smaller cable and gauge sizes .
 We sell our products and services to the major global global OEMs in every region of the world . Our ten largest customers accounted for approximately 55% of our total net sales for the year ended December 31, 2024 . We typically supply products to our customers through purchase orders, which are generally governed by general terms and conditions established by each OEM .
 Customers place orders for their requirements of specific components supplied for particular vehicles but are not required to purchase any minimum amount of products from us . Prices are negotiated with respect to each business award, which may be subject to adjustments under certain circumstances . We manufacture and ship based on customer release schedules, normally provided on a weekly basis .
 Firm orders are generally limited to specific and authorized customer purchase order releases placed with our manufacturing and distribution centers for actual production and order fulfillment . Firm orders typically fulfilled as promptly as possible from conversion of available raw materials, sub-components and work-in-process inventory for OEM orders . As of December 31, 2024, we have not experienced any significant shortages of raw materials .
 Commodity cost volatility, most notably related to copper, petroleum-based resin products and fuel, is a challenge for us and our industry . The industry has been subjected to increased pricing pressures, specifically in relation to these commodities, which have experienced significant volatility in price . We are continually seeking to manage these and other material-related cost pressures using a combination of strategies .
 As of December 31, 2024, we employed approximately 141,000 people; 31,000 salaried employees and 110,000 hourly employees . Approximately 50% of our total workforce were women, and approximately 25% of management roles were held by women . We are a global company serving every major worldwide market .
 Aptiv is committed to talent development and growing the next generation of leaders . A key accomplishment in 2024 included sustaining pay equity by race in the U.S. and gender pay equity among comparable roles globally . We manage succession planning as part of our monthly cadence and segment, technical, and senior executive leadership succession plans are reviewed with the CHRC .
 At Aptiv, we value each individual’s perspective and we foster an environment of respect and inclusion . We continue to focus on developing great people in order to maximize organizational effectiveness . Leveraging our employees’ diverse backgrounds and experiences allows us to make better decisions and supports stronger performance . We conduct regular employee feedback surveys to ensure employees have the opportunity to be heard .
 Sustainability has always been core to Aptiv’s business, values and culture . We are committed to ensuring all of our manufacturing sites are ISO 45001 certified by 2025 . As of December 31, 2024, 85% of our sites are certified under this standard . The company is committed to reducing its environmental footprint throughout its operations .
 Aptiv has committed to the Science-Based Targets initiative (the “SBTi”) Business Ambition for 1.5℃ campaign . Greenhouse gas emissions to be net-zero across the value chain by 2050 at the latest . The company aims to reduce its carbon footprint by decreasing our carbon footprint, reducing waste generated and consuming less water in operations .
 Our goal is to reduce water consumption in high-risk (water-scarce) locations by 2% per year through 2025 . We are also committed to reducing waste, with a waste recycled target (volume of recycled waste divided by total waste volume) of 80%. We continue to strive to actively reduce and manage waste across our manufacturing operations, as well as in our offices .
 Kevin P. Clark, 62, is chairman of Aptiv’s board of directors and chief executive officer . Varun Laroyia, 53, is executive vice president and chief financial officer, effective November 2024 . Mr. Clark joined from LKQ Corporation, a provider of alternative and specialty parts to repair and accessorize automobiles .
 Allan J. Brazier, 58, is vice president and chief accounting officer of Aptiv . Javed Khan, 52, is president of Software and Advanced Safety and User Experience . Joseph T. Liotine is executive vice president, Electrical Distribution Systems, a position he has held since November 2024 . Mr. Liotsine began his career at PepsiCo, where he held several positions within sales and procurement .
 Benjamin Lyon joined Aptiv from Astra Space, Inc., a provider of space products and launch services to the global space industry . Joseph R. Massaro joined the Company in October 2013 as vice president, Internal Audit, and in September 2014 was appointed to the position of VP, corporate controller . Benjamin Lyon served as senior director – Special Projects Group at Apple Inc. from April 2014 to February 2021 .
 Katherine H. Ramundo, 57, is executive vice president, chief legal officer, chief compliance officer and secretary of Aptiv . She joined the company from Howmet Aerospace Inc. (formerly Arconic Inc.) in November 2016 to February 2021 . Mr. Massaro was a managing director at Liberty Lane Partners from 2008 to 2010 .
 She began her career as a litigator, practicing at major New York-based law firms, including Cravath, Swaine & Moore and Sidley Austin . d later managed global specialty legal activities, including managing global special legal activities . She is also a lawyer who advises clients in the U.S. and Europe .
